website_summaries.verdict: A go-to sock for hot weather wear, but the lightweight material sacrifices cushioning and comfort.
pros: Lightweight cotton blend keeps feet dry and comfortable in warm weather
Reinforced heel helps extend sock life
Toe seam is flat, helping to prevent blisters from friction
Simple design goes with most outfits
cons: Many users find the socks to be too thin and not well-cushioned

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Here is where "you get what you pay for". I am very disappointed with the quality of these socks. The material is extremely thin, and after washing they shrunk by about a third in length---so their socks, they stretch, yes but they are already thin/cheep material and will probably wear holes after just a few wearings :( Disappointed as I believed this company (Hanes) to have a better product than this!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L. Wenkel

customer_reviews.title: CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: I HAD been buying Hanes crew socks for years--- These are so cheap and flimsy, it's ridiculous! Save your money: It's too bad. It's a great idea for those who like to wear cotton socks which are so hard to find these days. I could see straight out of the package that the elastics were cheap and weren't going to work-- and they don't. They also run small... I wear a size 7.5 shoe and the heel on these made it to about 3/4 the way to my heel... What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: SassySoprano

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these socks because I had bought the same ones years ago, and it was time to quit wearing ones with holes in the heel. They are really comfortable and really soft, but the material is a little thinner than they used to be. A bit disappointed in that, because I'm thinking they won't last nearly as long as my previous ones, but otherwise I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Y.

customer_reviews.title: Probably not Hanes.
customer_reviews.text: These are not the high quality socks I expect from Hanes. They are thin and not very soft. I am not convinced they are actually Hanes. They do say Hanes on the toe, but knock off Coach purses also say Coach. Won't purchase again. The sock in my pic is brand new out of the package from today.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J

customer_reviews.title: These do NOT. STAY. UP.
customer_reviews.text: These socks DO. NOT. STAY. UP. The socks themselves fit just fine on the foot, but they seem to have no elastic to hold them up! They're so loose that they slide right down - all the way down -- immediately. You put 'em on, you take one step, and there they are, around your heel.I thought it may have been one defective pair, but when I checked all of them, they all had the same problem. I donated the whole pack to a homeless shelter.
customer_reviews.author: SF Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay up
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I needed black socks which wouldn't keep falling down and bunching up in my shoes. Unfortunately, straight out of the package these socks do exactly that. Them seem fine when I first put them on but an hour later I keep having to pull them back up. Even when folded over, they refuse to stay on. This is expected disappointing because I sized down from what I'd normally buy for my size 10 wide feet in the hope they'd be tighter.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D

customer_reviews.title: They sure don't make Hanes socks the way they used to.
customer_reviews.text: I used Hanes socks for about 10 years. I was excited to get new socks, because my old Hanes had finally seen the last of days. The old Hanes lasted me 6 months. The ones that were shipped to me, where horrendous! The elasticity on the top wore out within a week (see pics) and all the socks didn't have the stamina that they used to. Holes appeared in two weeks! I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Marie Petrakos

customer_reviews.title: and I was surprised that they fit really great, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I bought these Hanes crew socks in size that saids fit Shoe size 5 to 9,! Which I wear a size 8 or 81/2 sneakers, and I was surprised that they fit really great, comfortable, because in stores I buy size 9 to 11! And the review I read were mixed reviewed so I didn't know what to think, but I like Hanes brand ! I will buy again! I really like this socks , there are soft and comfortable , well thank you, I hope this helps someone to try out! K.Reddin
customer_reviews.author: Reddin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, thin and feel synthetic
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these socks for a couple of years and have been totally satisfied until now. Hanes has downgraded the quality so low that I'll never buy them again. They used to be thick, soft and comfortable. Now they're thin, feel synthetic and offer very little protection. I paid around $7 for them and they're not worth the price. If you've bought them before and think they're okay, think again.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: These are the size socks i always buy and i generally buy Hanes too. These were small enough that after washing i habe dificulty telling whether these are mine or my 3 year old daughters. They also feel like they are already washed and rough on the inside. I always look forward to that super soft inside of a sock when theyare brand new so i was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Cheap enough, but thinner and smaller than Hanes socks I have bought previously
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I bought six pairs of similar socks from Hanes and they have held up pretty well, although they have gotten a bit dingy because I don't use bleach. After doing a load of laundry I was sorting and folding old and new socks before putting them away, and the new socks are definitely thinner and shorter than the old ones. At first I thought they might even be counterfeit - but I guess it is just a matter of 'making it cheaper'. I would rather pay more and get better quality.
customer_reviews.author: An Unfashionable Woman

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: New Cheap Product under Old Label (Hanes Changed Fabric)
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these socks for years and I loved them. A month ago, I purchased from the same exact link, and the socks they sent me are TERRIBLE. They are super thin and flimsy. They came in an official sealed Hanes bag, but this is not the same product. The bag says "Now Softer" so I'm not sure if they changed the formula. But either way, this is a totally different product. It's a cheap flimsy sock that offers no cushion or warmth and tears easily. They should market these under a different banner, rather than trying to sell a new cheap version of the product under the old label.
customer_reviews.author: Element Apple

customer_reviews.title: Very thin. Quality went down
customer_reviews.text: these are very thin at the ankle and above. I ordered the exact same type of Hanes sock a year ago and they used to be great quality. They clearly changed the thickness. Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer2000

customer_reviews.title: Decline in Quality over time
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst! Socks are so thin they are see through in the elastic area, they fall down and have little to no cushion. I'm very disappointed, because the recent shipment I received of these was a re-order. The previous times I have purchased these socks they have been wonderful, I just needed some more so I went ahead and re-ordered. This time the quality is markedly poor and I had to just toss them out--wasn't even worth trying to re-wear a pair after the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah N. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Nice sock, but disappointed in quality control
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the socks, but was very disappointed that right out of the package 2 socks already have holes in them in the exact same spot. There were no tags that could have caused these holes. I saw them right after putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: 58% Cotton, 40% Polyester, 1% Spandex, 1% Nylon (since the description does not tell you)
customer_reviews.text: I find it annoying that the fabric content is not listed on the product description, only “cotton-rich.” Cotton rich turned out to be 58% cotton, 40% polyester, 1% spandex, and 1% nylon. Now was that so hard to put on the description? I’d like to rate them down for being deceptive, but these are decent everyday socks that I wear with tennis shoes to work in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Delta_S

customer_reviews.title: A buck a pair is worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in Aug. 2015. I'm about to order another 10-pack today. Are they the best of the best insofar as socks go? Heck no. But they average a buck a pair and these socks, which I wear at least five days a week for a gym workout or traipsing around the hills of San Francisco, lasted - on average - about four years before holes started to appear. Again - a buck a pair, people. Very happy with this purchase considering the cost / use ratio. See you back here in 2025 for my next review - cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Battista

customer_reviews.title: Great daily wear socks...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Hanes socks for years and I love them. They fit perfectly, conforming to the feet from heel to toe. I provided pics to show that the soles are thicker than the top. The image makes the top appear fairly sheer, but it's not. That's just the camera being generous with light. As you can see in one of my pics, the socks are thinner are top. However, they do not look sheer like that in person.
customer_reviews.author: I Am....

customer_reviews.title: I have bought before and quality not the same.
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new pack every year or so and this last pack is completely different in quality. Thinner and cheaper feeling. I'm sure it's to cut costs or something but it is completely noticeable. Not good, Hanes, not good. I am not equating the Hanes name with quality. EDIT: I still have socks from before I bought this last bunch that have held up better than this last batch. This one with the holes shows how the quality had gone down.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I'm rather particular about the feel and fit of socks. These are comfortable on my feet and my ankles. They feel smooth and stay up all day. I recently bought some Fruit of the Loom crew socks that ran much smaller than these Hanes, and they are supposedly the same size. I can't even wear the Fruit of the Loom socks because they are so tight. The Hanes are just right.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Holterman

customer_reviews.title: Not like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: These socks have been a staple for me for many years. But now Hanes has changed several things and they are awful now. First, the padded sole (extra terrycloth on sole) is gone. The socks feel thinner now. But the worst part is the blend of materials they are made from. Says 76 percent cotton and 23 percent polyester. All they feel like to me is pure polyester. The old model was much more "cottony" and absorbent in the Arizona heat. These just made your feet sweat and feel clammy. Won't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Deb D

customer_reviews.title: Bring back the 100% cotton Hanes socks HANES!!
customer_reviews.text: Love Hanes. Love Haines just disappointed in United States industry trying to save the big American dollar by cutting back on the amount of cotton they use in the socks years ago it was 100% cotton now it's not so that they can save money and they add polyester because it's cheaper and makes your feet sweat and stink!!
customer_reviews.author: JustLilMe

customer_reviews.title: The quality has decreased over the years!
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these socks, but every pack I buy gets worse and worse. In the beginning, they were a nice black sock that stayed up and lasted for months without wear & tear. The last pack didn't even fit. The socks were misshapen and stretched out. They fall down instantly and slide into my shoe. They also get holes after 1-2 wears. I will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Socks are good. But packaging was open
customer_reviews.text: The socks arrived fine, and all ten pair arrived, and they fit well, and are comfy. However, when they arrived, the package was already open, and the contents were strewn around the box they were shipped in. I'm not sure what happened there. This was a reorder of the socks after I got notified that my original order was "undeliverable". Very strange.
customer_reviews.author: Heather McLeod

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE and a Good Price !
customer_reviews.text: I really like these!. The lower part of the sock isnt gargantuan and floppy (Im a size 8.5 shoe) as sometimes socks are WAY too big. The elasticized tops are also nice and stretchy, not too tight. I wear them to work. The fabric is very cottony (although not 100%). As I recall the label said 75% cotton. That is a nice combination. Very happy. Will probably be buying another package.
customer_reviews.author: Doglover

customer_reviews.title: Holes after only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in January. Two socks already have holes. One in the toe area and one on the bottom. I've had Hanes socks in the past that lasted for years. These are really low quality. I will not buy these again. I am disappointed as Hanes has been my go to for socks.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Too Thin and Slick
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered some Hanes Womens Crew Athletic Socks a couple of years ago and now need new ones. The wording on these seemed correct, so I ordered one pack. I do not like them at all. They are thin and have too much polyester or some synthetic in them making them very slick in my shoe. Since I've worn a pair, I will keep them, but I am in search of something else and will not wear these unless I have no others clean at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Hanes womens crew socks for years and bought these even after reading the reviews thinking that the negative reviews were not true ... they are true these are NOT the Hanes socks that they use to make. I am returning them and I never return things and don't ususally write bad reviews but I can't believe Hanes would put out a product like this!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Shannon

customer_reviews.title: listed incorrectly!
customer_reviews.text: They are not for big and tall women! You xan see plainly it says size 5-9 shoe that us NOT the sox size. They are listed incorrectly as big and tall. Not even close. Ordered 2 pkgs will attempt to return them. One answer to a question was That 5-9 was the sox size it is not! Don't be fooled!
customer_reviews.author: Chefette

customer_reviews.title: really nice socks , definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: these socks are thick & very comfortable but they’re not as soft :( i still recommend if you just want to buy socks like these for outfits that involve these peeking out of your shoes. i do have a small foot ( 3.5 in youth / size 5 in women ) so they do fit a little big on me but it’s not too much :)
customer_reviews.author: karla

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING like preivous Hanes women's crews
customer_reviews.text: These are VERY thin. I've worn and loved Hanes socks for years. On these, the elastic part above the foot is so thin it;'s actually see-through when you put it on. I thought they were Hanes rip-offs. I don't know how people say they're "mid-calf". I'm 5'6"and they are maybe 1/3-calf" if I stretch them. Stay-up power is moderate. I would have returned them but for the hassles of mailing them back.
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: Texture much too rough!
customer_reviews.text: These are the roughest socks I have ever felt - actually, the roughest articles of clothing in general. As soon as I opened the bag and touched them I knew they wouldn't work for me. I have sensitive skin, and these feel like sandpaper. I'm not sure what I'm going to do with them since I've already opened the bag, but I will try seeing if putting them though the washing machine will help at all. I will update if this works.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Tei

customer_reviews.title: Good price, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Just like all Hanes products, the quality of these socks as declined over the years. They are much thinner and have less elastic overall. The tops are prone to slip down your ankles and the bottoms are easy to slide around. The only good thing about them is the price. I will be looking for a better sock.
customer_reviews.author: Caley G

customer_reviews.title: May be too small for a wide foot
customer_reviews.text: Love Hanes for my work boots, I always wear two pair, and these work well, they did slid down but I believe it's the new sock coating, a couple of washes and they'll be fine, I've had them last for years, but I think it's my two pair method, which is cheaper than gold toe, which I love too. Alone they are thin but that works with a sneaker not a boot.
customer_reviews.author: S.C. st petersburg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in these having been wearing Hanes socks for years. There is a heavy seam across the toes and they are stiff even after washing, not soft at all. I have issues with my feet and are not able to wear them. After they were washed they did shrink to the point that they are too small. I can't send them back because I washed them and no longer have the packaging. By far the worst purchase on Amazon for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marigold

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!
customer_reviews.text: I have these exact same socks that I bought from Target and those are so much better! The material for these socks is awful and course. They are very stiff and the pink Hanes on the bottom is all patchy like these are knock offs. Horrible, but I can't send them back since I've already worn them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicho

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this same pack of socks in 2015, and they lasted me for 3 years. Back then, the socks were thick and they stayed up. This time around, the socks are super thin. They are constantly falling down in my boots. I am so disappointed in the diminished quality of these socks. They will definitely not last the three years I was able to get out of the previous pack of the same socks.
customer_reviews.author: mom and teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: I read the review from the person who said these socks did not stay up or fit the foot properly. I was looking for socks that were not tight because of too much elastic. I took the reviewer's words and thought that is what I want! They are perfect...just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Fifer

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit and appearance
customer_reviews.text: This product was just what I expected. It looks nice and fits very well. It washes and dries in in my washer and dryer very niceIy. I was just disappointed that the pack contained that many pairs of socks. I would have liked to have fewer pairs in the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Bj

customer_reviews.title: Always Hanes
customer_reviews.text: I bought some other socks a little while back and I don’t know why I did. Hanes socks fit the best. I am not a fan of tight fitting socks and these socks fit great and are comfortable. They usually last around 6 months before having to get new socks but that is because I usually walk around in my socks.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: You need these!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly love these wayyy too much. I’ve worn thin patterned socks and athletic socks my whole life and always wondered why some shoes were a quarter size too big or why my feet always got cold at home in socks. I wear these EVERY DAY at home when I’m lounging around even though I just got them to wear with my new Fila shoes. They’re amazing and I just bought them in black as well. Lifechanging, great durability, and comfy as hell
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Socks mutate after washing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they appear identical to the men's Hanes athletic socks on the website. They're not. The first time my wife wore them they were fine, but after a single wash they shrunk and turned into a mutant mess. The men's socks do not do this. I'm being generous giving these three stars.
customer_reviews.author: hotdog12

customer_reviews.title: Baggy and terrible
customer_reviews.text: Worst socks I've ever worn in my life! They don't stay up, they're baggy even though I have large feet, they're thin, they're scratchy, and overall awful. They feel like burlap. I would rather go barefoot than bother with wearing these. I would feel guilty donating them to an unsuspecting individual. I guess they're dusting rags now.
customer_reviews.author: Makra V.R. Leskovia

customer_reviews.title: These socks do the job but poor quality compared to the old Hanes socks
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting Hanes women's socks for decades. The last few years I've noticed the quality of the socks has seriously declined. When you pull them up now you have to do it by the base of the sock or else they rip and you end up with big holes in them or the top stretches out so bad they slouch down. Overall they work if you are careful, they just don't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had my current ones for a couple years and they've held up perfectly. I'm purchasing another set now only because I have a bad habit if washing everything together and they end up either blueish or grayish after a while. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Meda

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light socks
customer_reviews.text: These are nice not thick crew socks. Fit is good, no bunching at toes or heal (I wear 8.5 shoe size), they stay up great. If your looking for a warm or winter wear sock, these are not them, they are light and medium thickness. Good value in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Fit great
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10 shoes and these socks fit great. I need solid black socks for work and these pass. They sit about 4" above my ankles. I normally like longer crew socks for the winter months but I'm okay with these and for the price. They say reinforced toes and bottoms which I can say they are thicker there but thinner then Im use to on top but overall I'm really happy with them and when the dryer decides to eat them I'll be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea ParkerTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: These socks are way too small...
customer_reviews.text: These socks have so small of a leg and foot opening that I couldn’t even get it on my foot. I don’t understand how they can be called big and tall women’s socks. As you might guess I’m irritated once again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: Shapeless after six months
customer_reviews.text: These socks were great at first with a good fit and they stayed pulled up until about six months of wearing and washing. They slowly started falling down during the day and now they slide down past my ankles and bunch up in my shoes. I can’t wear them at all at this point. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work at a grocery store. My feet stay pretty dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where did these socks come from I always wear this brand never had them shrink before
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the socks opened the package I liked the socks they were a little smaller than expected but honest to God I washed them and dried them the socks are seriously without exaggeration the size of maybe a 5 year olds idk what happened here
customer_reviews.author: Angela Van Brunt

customer_reviews.title: In much less than a year garters are needed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in May 2017 and my wife only wears then during the summer weekdays for gardening. In about 4-5 months of wear the elastic is shot in what’s any otherwise good sock. She takes a few steps and then has to bend down to pull them up. Needless to say she won’t be doing that every day she’s in the garden. Perhaps they’ll be good for cleaning the blinds but as for footwear they’re terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: No longer high-quality socks
customer_reviews.text: Hanes used to have very good quality sucks. I could buy 18 of them, and not need to buy any more for five years. However, this has all changed. These socks are thinner, slide around the heel, and in general are of very poor quality. I will be donating the socks, and ended up buying Nike, which are 10 times better, comfortable, and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Raberdash

customer_reviews.title: Quality gone down drastically :(
customer_reviews.text: Wow, Hanes quality has gone down drastically. I had to return them because they were so uncomfortable. They feel rough on my skin and the pattern of the sock is terrible to stand on. The seam on top of the toes is short in both directions and almost ends up underneath. The edges of this seam cut into the top of my feet (size 8 shoe). Please go back to your previous manufacturer, Hanes. I miss your cozy socks!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Giftable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these last Christmas and gave them as gifts to several ladies. Some say they’re the best socks. I purchased them again and am gifting others as well as myself.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: These are possibly the worst quality socks I have ever owned in my 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: These are possibly the worst quality socks I have ever owned in my 30 year of life. They're thin, non-conforming pieces of cloth essentially. I just went out to TJ Maxx and got a pack of ten for 6 dollars. Don't let Amazon fool you into thinking everything is cheaper here. If I had all ten pairs left I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Thick, long and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best socks I've had in years. They're also great at night when I moisturize my poor dry feet and put a fresh pair on. With this many pairs, I can spare two pairs a day without being overwhelmed with laundering them. I highly recommend these great socks!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Foga

customer_reviews.title: Great socks.
customer_reviews.text: Not too thick or too thin. Perfect fit and not too tight on the legs. I have large ankles, so that’s important for me. I didn’t expect to like them this much.
customer_reviews.author: KC shopper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Hanes socks for years but this batch was so frustrating. No matter which show I wore the socks with, they bunches down around my ankle and under my feet. So annoying to constantly have to pull the socks back up - even after being washed, switching shoes, and with leggings
customer_reviews.author: breezer01

customer_reviews.title: The socks themselves fit fine. However
customer_reviews.text: The socks themselves fit fine. However, I found that the material wears out rather quickly after being worn a few times. I have noticed a trend of developing holes on the back of my foot just above the heel. These are OK if you just need some cheap socks and aren't concerned about durability. If you want something that will last longer, you'll have to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A.

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss in quality
customer_reviews.text: They fit your feet as they should, but are very loose on the crew part. I wear work boots to work and these slide down below my boot. I've been buying these socks for years and it seems like the quality is always hit or miss; some packages are tight, most are loose. Time to start trying some other brands and stop wasting my money on a guessing game of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Quality getting substandard- thinner than before
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these same socks for years and always loved them. However, this last batch is much thinner and they don't stay up.The elastic portion around the ankle is way too thin and doesn't stay up well. I bought them to replace some of my older ones that had gotten holes in the heels, but one pair already has gotten a hole in the ribbed (elastic) part and none of my previous socks have ever gotten holes there. Seems like Hanes has dramatically reduced the quality to save money, or else they changed manufacturers who are not upholding the previous Hanes QC specs.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Y

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy and stretch to fit
customer_reviews.text: I have been loyal to this brand for years and years, because I love how they feel. They feel cozy, but are breathable. I like their price. They stretch to fit your size. I just love them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Less quality than they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: These are thin. I had to get new socks because I finally had to purchase replacements for my last set of Hanes socks, which I purchased a few years ago. I was starting to get holes in those. These ones are so thin that the holes will come much quicker and in fact are so stretched on my feet because they're too small that I'm pretty sure I'll be buying replacements in the next few months. Sadly, it seems Hanes has gone the way of other companies and are cheapening the production process but charging more. Too bad, really.
customer_reviews.author: Naivasna

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: These socks are terrible! The top loses its elasticity and then they just fall down and twist. They are literally down at the ball of my foot by mid morning if I wear them with uggs.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary G Willmann

customer_reviews.title: Ring doorbell to ensure protection from theft.
customer_reviews.text: This item was not left in a secure location. I was at home when the package arrived and my doorbell was not rung; package was left in an unlocked entryway.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C. Kubacki

customer_reviews.title: Athletic socks, in black
customer_reviews.text: These are perfectly fine athletic style socks. They are not what I wanted. I was looking for a black cotton anklet - thicker, more casual than a trouser sock, but not a thick, spongy athletic sock. These are the sort with the terry type loops on the inside of the sole. Fine as they are, but not as the description let me hope they were.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never have to worry about matching
customer_reviews.text: I always buy these socks. They are practical and comfy. And best of all I don't have to worry about matching them I just throw them all in my sock drawer.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaBee

customer_reviews.title: Holey socks in 1 month!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these socks in April. It is now May 17th and there are holes in the heels. Can't believe I bought 20 pairs of Hanes socks and they are in shreds in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: betsy johnston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect socks for me. They fit my size 7.5-8 wide foot well. So soft & my feet dont sweat as much as in regular socks. I’ll buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed...smaller than I expected...extremely thin... I can see my skin-tone through them when I put them on. These are not as thick as ones I’ve purchased in the past from Hanes.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Bad.dont reccomend
customer_reviews.text: It shreds on your feet so when you take then off and go take a shower the black is on your feet and goes down the shower drain
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Good for kankles
customer_reviews.text: Comfy socks (: I have issues with an ankle that is swollen. All I've ever worn is ankle socks and needed something taller for ankle brace use. These work perfect.
customer_reviews.author: lizsty1e

customer_reviews.title: Small and thin
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 shoe. I've never had a problem with socks fitting until I bought these. They slide down my foot until the gray heel part is underneath my heel. I wouldn't suggest these if you are larger than a size 6. I'm going to give them to my mom who wears a size 5. They also aren't as thick as I expected. They aren't horrible, they would make a decent summer sock, and they are also really thin on the top. When I pull them all the way up, I can see my skin through them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Partin

customer_reviews.title: Pineapples.
customer_reviews.text: These used to be great socks, utilitarian, comfortable and sturdy. I keep buying them whenever I run out. The last time I bought them, they felt very short and the material was flimsy and got holes after a week. They were particularly weak at the ankles. I used them because I had to leave on a trip right away. I will buy again to see if it was a fluke, or if I should try another brand. Seller sent the item extremely quickly, no hitches. Am satisfied with seller response.
customer_reviews.author: Consuelo Bananahammock

customer_reviews.title: Good size, keeps its shape
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the size (I wear size 8 1/2 shoes), as they don't bag around the heel or toes. Keep their shape well, so I can wear for a while, take them off, put them back on later and they still fit nicely. Soft, comfy cotton - mmmm.
customer_reviews.author: Angi Bailey

customer_reviews.title: socks irritate my skin
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these socks because I had similar socks before which were perfect. However these socks irritate my skin. I wanted to contact the seller through Amazon to find out what materials they were made of. However, Amazon has made that impossible to do .
customer_reviews.author: DLS

customer_reviews.title: My favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: These are the only crew socks I've worn for years. They fit well, are comfortable, and hold up for a decent amount of time before they get holes in them.
customer_reviews.author: girlwonder87

customer_reviews.title: Be careful how you search
customer_reviews.text: I should know better than to expect a search for 100% cotton socks to be free from dishonest descriptions. I really should have read more carefully. I didn't expect a nationally known brand like Hanes to pull this search engine BS. To be clear, they promote this as "100% cotton/polyester". As though I might be concerned that their would be some other fiber in there, POLLUTING the polyester.
customer_reviews.author: Anonnynonny

customer_reviews.title: Worst quality socks
customer_reviews.text: Awful socks! Thin material, elastic is weak making them slide and stretch to no return. They struck down to half their original size after first wash (see photo).
customer_reviews.author: GGoneau

customer_reviews.title: Yikes
customer_reviews.text: Please don't waste your money on these. I made a mistake by buying these. They are loose, the material feels like 100% poly (plastic). I absolutely hate socks that are extremely scratchy and can't stay on my leg without sliding down every 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: jj kim

customer_reviews.title: My favorite socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks are warm, cozy, and hold up well to wash and wear repeatedly. I wear a pair almost daily with my work boots, or even just around the house to keep my feet from getting cold on the hardwood and tile floors in my house. As long as my dogs don't get a hold of them, I can count on them to last a very long time :)
customer_reviews.author: Mizz Liz

customer_reviews.title: Thin socks
customer_reviews.text: I would’ve like the socks to be a little thicker. They are on the thin side. I’ve had no issues thus far with holes or sagginess.
customer_reviews.author: Sooneal

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and happy
customer_reviews.text: These hanes socks are my favorite everyday comfort and perfect for the winter they are warm enough for my foot. They fit perfect they are so soft and bouncy when they are new. I recommend this product it is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Theadora Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very nice socks
customer_reviews.text: Great socks. As a matter of fact, I think my son stole them and took them off to graduate school with him! He loves them too!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel T.

customer_reviews.title: Thinnest socks ever. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: These are soooo thin. I have to wear 2 sock at a time on each foot to actually get warmth & cushion. Wish I could return these don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Leslies Blushing

customer_reviews.title: Quality at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the support it gave me and they are not to thick or to light weighted. Keeps my feet and toes cozy and warm in winter. Quality at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: My favorites
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear these socks (or the ones with the pink toes) because they are super comfortable. They always fit right and are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Soft for long walks
customer_reviews.text: When looking for a soft sock I always buy Hanes but when purchased at two different stores they were slippery as heck and didn't return them. When I found these on Amazon I had my fingers crossed hoping they would be what I needed. So soft, perfect fit, wash and wear no shinking. So thanks Amazon and Hanes,
customer_reviews.author: donna sebilia

customer_reviews.title: Runs a bit small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my normal sock size, and they were a bit too small. Every pair I had (ordered 20 pair) ripped on the back of my heal. Not the bottom, but right where the sole of the sock meets the elastic top. Only got to wear each pair about twice. Must have ripped Bc they were a bit small. Good quality just not true to size
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla Lubbock

customer_reviews.title: Constantly falling down
customer_reviews.text: The elastic on these socks is worthless. If you wear them without footwear they'll stay up for a little while, but the moment they have to put in a little effort and act like crew socks, forget it. They give up and fall down around your ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: ... pair out of the package and they literally looked like little girl socks
customer_reviews.text: I took a pair out of the package and they literally looked like little girl socks, the foot part was so small. I double checked my order and the package to see if a mistake was made, but both were labeled "womens". Maybe these are meant to stretch over the foot, but I wasn't interested in torturing my feet, so I returned them. A real shame, because it was a great price.
customer_reviews.author: lovemy2pooches

customer_reviews.title: Serve purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these socks forever, it seems, and I wear them a lot. I just take for granted, they do not have longevity and after a year, replace them. The price is good and they serve their purpose. At the end of the year, they start getting holes, usually on the bottoms, but not on the heels. That is the time to toss them. If you are looking for long term wear, my experience has not proven this to be.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Selig

customer_reviews.title: Tight, and not meaning "cool"
customer_reviews.text: I usually always buy the same kind of hanes socks so that all my socks match, but I couldnt find these in stores anymore! I ordered the same size I usually get (9-11) Yet these seemed to run a little smaller than they usually did for me. They were much tighter than all my others when they were new and I wear a 9.5-10 so I wasnt expecting that... that being said I think an 11 would be a bit uncomfortable to squeeze into these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Tatt2edtears06

customer_reviews.title: My wife was disappointed in these socks
customer_reviews.text: My wife was disappointed in these socks. She has been buying Hanes socks for years and now the quality is so poor that she won't be buying them again. She also tried the Fruit of the Loom socks, which were even thinner so she sent those back. There is no "cushion" in the soles and the leg part is so thin that it won't stay up and twists around her ankles. She will keep the Hanes socks because she is in desperate need of socks, but won't be buying them again. She was so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: wally

customer_reviews.title: These are some of the best women's crew socks.
customer_reviews.text: I like these socks with the Cushing, but I thought they would be a little bigger. They still fit and feel good tho. Patti S.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia  Sorrenson

customer_reviews.title: Sucky
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased these before a few years back. Needed to get more and saw the deal online. They were awful. Take a few steps and they start to slide down. I felt like every few minutes I had to keep pulling them up from bunching in my shoe. They were soft, but a lil lightweight. They used to be a lil heavier. Not sure if the company changed their sock manufacturer, Or if these were fake BUT THEY TOTALLY SUCKED ,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality has diminished from previous purchases
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn this brand for years but find my most recent purchase lacks in expected quality. The cuff of the socks became “twisted” after they were laundered and are shorter than previous Hanes socks I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: High Expectations

customer_reviews.title: Nice socks
customer_reviews.text: Not the softest sucks I've owned, but are still fine socks. I was running low and borrowing my husband's socks. I buy everyone else in my family socks but myself! I was happy to find this set of 10 for such a good price. Received them quickly with prime. Thanks Amazon! No more cold feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, but surprisingly happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought presuming they were a version of athletic socks. The look is accurate but they do not have the thickness however I'm happy. They are short (small slouch), thin and work perfectly in a stylish tennis shoe that needs more than a footie sock. Admittedly they are 79% cotton, 18% cotton and then natural latex, rubber, nylon and spandex. I like them but they have not been washed as of yet. If my opinion changes I will be sure to update.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

product_meta.title: Hanes Big and Tall Women's 10 Pack Crew Sock
product_meta.description: 10 pack extra durable value pack crew sock with reinforced heel and toe
feature_bullets: The road can be rough. These crew socks help make it a little smoother
Soft cotton-rich knit breathes for cooling comfort
A hint of spandex ensures a better fit
Plush cushioned foot bottom soothes your every step
Reinforced heel and toe resist wear & tear
